intro: Notothixos incanus var. cornifolius, commonly known as the hairy antlered grass, is a variant of the species Notothixos incanus. It is a member of the Poaceae family, commonly referred to as the grass family. This plant is characterized by its hairy, often reddish stems and distinctive, lance-shaped leaves. The inflorescence consists of spikelets that are typically arranged in a panicle, with each spikelet bearing two to three florets. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as sandy soils and grasslands, often in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
